decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing numbers: Location and Block Plan TK/PA24/100A, Existing & Proposed Floor Plans TK/PA24/101A.

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | The large house of multiple occupation hereby approved shall be limited to no more than four (4) rooms and ten (10) occupants.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies with policy D6 of the London Plan (2021), policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013), policies 1.1 (e) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) policies 7.4 and 7B, London Plan (2021) policy D3 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023). | Provision for 4 cycle storage spaces as shown on the approved plans and in accordance with adopted standards shall be provided prior to occupation and be continuously available and retained for the life of the development hereby approved.

Reason: In the interests of the adequate bicycle storage provision and in the interests of reducing congestion to the local transport network, in accordance with policies 1.1 (j) and 3.1(i) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy T5 of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2023). | Refuse and recycling storage as indicated on the approved plans and in accordance with the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority, shall be implemented and made available prior to the first occupation of any part of the development and retained in perpetuity.

Reason:  To ensure that suitable and accessible refuse storage facilities are provided and in the interests of the visual and general amenities of the area, in accordance with policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policy SI7 of the London Plan (2021). | Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of enhanced sound insulation values of at least 10dB above the ADE Building Regulations values, for the floor/ceiling/wall structures separating different types of rooms/uses in adjoining dwellings/areas, namely, bedrooms below/above/adjoining communal kitchen/WC/shower room and adjoining the communal main entrance/hallway and staircase. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D14 of The London Plan (2021), Standard 30 of the Housing SPG , Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).
description: Change of use of a single dwellinghouse (Use Class C3) into a large house in multiple-occupation comprising  four bedrooms (10 persons) (Use Class Sui Generis)
